instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't chime after interrupted MacOS update
threads.message:
Hello guys, I have been reading this forum and watching Louis videos for a long time and now I need some help so I decided to register.

A client bringed to me his Macbook air 11" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> early 2015 board which he turned off in the middle of a system update. I have already checked the board and every single voltage is present, but it doesn't POST. I believe efi got corrupted. Is there any place where can I get a clean ME bin file for this board?

Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't chime after interrupted MacOS update
threads.message:
We can try first to correct original BIOS.
Read <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and upload its dump somewhere, then post the link.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't chime after interrupted MacOS update
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't chime after interrupted MacOS update
threads.message:
Were you able to download the file? Please let me know if you need anything else. 

Thank you!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't chime after interrupted MacOS update
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't chime after interrupted MacOS update
threads.message: Tried the first one and the board is fully working again. Thank you for your help!! :)
